snippet: College acceptance letters are increasingly telling applicants to show up at midyear, an economic benefit for the colleges but a shock to the students.
abstract: College acceptance letters are increasingly telling applicants to show up at midyear rather than fall semester, economic benefit for colleges but shock to students; many of these colleges set up special midyear open houses and orientations, modeled on welcome-to-campus events that greet most first-year students.
lead_paragraph: College acceptance letters are increasingly telling applicants to show up at midyear, an economic benefit for the colleges but a shock to the students.

headline.seo: More College Applicants Don’t Get In Until Winter
headline.main: More College Applicants Aren’t Welcome Till Winter
headline.print_headline: More College Applicants Aren’t Welcome Till Winter

keywords.value: National Assn for College Admission Counseling
keywords.name: organizations
